Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition

Summary:  10 year, 1 mill property tax for the purpose of providing funds to match federal and state funds allocated to Vernon Parish for services to the elderly, including the establishment and maintenance of centers for senior citizens.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Vernon, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), be authorized to levy a one (1) mill tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of said tax for one entire year being $102,734) on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of providing funds to match federal and state funds allocated to Vernon Parish for services to the elderly, including the establishment and maintenance of centers for senior citizens?

Race.SpecificTitle: Orange School Dist No.145 -- $4,100,000 Bond - School Board - 25 Years
Race.SummaryText:
Orange School District No. 145 Proposition
(Bond)

Summary:  Authority to issue not exceeding $4,100,000 of 25 year general obligation bonds with the proceeds of the bonds to be used for the purpose of improving building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting, renovating and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities, including two activity buses, within and for the District, and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, to be paid from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall Orange School District No. 145 of Vernon Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Four Million One Hundred  Thousand Dollars ($4,100,000), to be issued in one or more series, to run not exceeding twenty-five (25) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of improving building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting, renovating and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities, including two activity buses, within and for the District, and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District, and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto?
